comment: It seemed to me the variation used to play by my opponent against system with g3 is rather doubious. That's why I chose this move. Nevertheless it was not so easy way indeed.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. g3 Bg7 4. Bg2 O-O 5. Nc3 d6 6. Nf3 Bg4 7. h3 Bxf3 8. Bxf3 Nc6 9. e3 Nd7 10. Bg2 a5 11. Qe2 e5 12. d5 Nb4 13. a3 Na6 14. Rb1 f5 15. e4 Nac5 16. b4 axb4 17. axb4 Na4 18. Nd1
comment: Very effective multifunctional move proving an advantage. White keeps a couple of pieces, consolidates plentifully the f2 square, clears the 3rd rank for the Rook (subsequently not for Rb1-b3 but Rh1-h3-a3!), and also threating 19.ef5 gf5 20.g4 and then it will be able to put the knight into the play through the e3 square.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. g3 Bg7 4. Bg2 O-O 5. Nc3 d6 6. Nf3 Bg4 7. h3 Bxf3 8. Bxf3 Nc6 9. e3 Nd7 10. Bg2 a5 11. Qe2 e5 12. d5 Nb4 13. a3 Na6 14. Rb1 f5 15. e4 Nac5 16. b4 axb4 17. axb4 Na4 18. Nd1 f4 19. h4 c5
comment: Makes White worsen his pawn structure of queenside.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. g3 Bg7 4. Bg2 O-O 5. Nc3 d6 6. Nf3 Bg4 7. h3 Bxf3 8. Bxf3 Nc6 9. e3 Nd7 10. Bg2 a5 11. Qe2 e5 12. d5 Nb4 13. a3 Na6 14. Rb1 f5 15. e4 Nac5 16. b4 axb4 17. axb4 Na4 18. Nd1 f4 19. h4 c5 20. dxc6 bxc6 21. h5 g5 22. h6 Bf6 23. Bh3 Kh8 24. Bf5 Ndb6 25. g4
comment: Strengthening the light-square bishop and preparing h1 Rook's manoevre.

comment: White threatens nothing immediately but Black is completely pinned and can't find any useful move.
